r-hbpseb r-16dba41 r-bnwqim" id="id__oniabwe72z" data-testid="tweetText" style="color: rgb(231, 233, 234);"><span class="css-1jxf684 r-bcqeeo r-1ttztb7 r-qvutc0 r-poiln3">there is so much space to do "living" docs generation where I work (and I assume in a lot of other places), where every push to master in every repo checks the git diffs of every PR and updates docs in some docs/*.md folder for both humans and LLM consumptions

You can then get all these docs/ folders across and synthesize them upstream so you can get, straight in repos:
- solid docs for humans
- condensed, high-signal docs for LLMs / codegen tools

but also get things like server/db/network topology, etc.... and said documents can all be fetched during codegen by devs

Then, in your knowledge DB upstream, you get this periodically updated living meta-doc of all your shit and RAG that thing up + Slack Bot or anything else

I know some other fairly-large companies do this (like Pinterest) but we don't and I think it must be built</span></div></div><div class="css-175oi2r"><div class="css-175oi2r"><div aria-label="13 replies, 8 reposts, 231 likes, 128 bookmarks, 18661 views" role="group" class="css-175oi2r r-1kbdv8c r-18u37iz r-1wtj0ep r-1ye8kvj r-rpnbwx" id="id__ewbn59t9cy5"><div class="css-175oi2r r-18u37iz r-1h0z5md r-13awgt0"><button aria-label="13 Replies. there is so much space to do "living" docs generation where I work (and I assume in a lot of other places), where every push to master in every repo checks the git diffs of every PR and updates docs in some docs/*.md folder for both humans and LLM consumptions You can then get all these docs/ folders across and synthesize them upstream so you can get, straight in repos: - solid docs for humans - condensed, high-signal docs for LLMs / codegen tools but also get things like server/db/network topology, etc.... and said documents can all be fetched during codegen by devs Then, in your knowledge DB upstream, you get this periodically updated living meta-doc of all your shit and RAG that thing up + Slack Bot or anything else I know some other fairly-large companies do this (like Pinterest) but we don't and I think it must be built
